basic.floral_language:
Duranta erecta 
Floriography: keen, warm-hearted, magical
Duranta erecta is an deciduous shrub, often confused with Winter jasmine (Jasminum nudiflorum). Duranta erecta is generally taller with upright branches. Flowering after leaf growth with 4-petal flowers of golden yellow, has elegant aroma. In addition to its landscaping values, it is famous for medicinal values in detoxification, relieving congestion and swelling etc.
Duranta erecta likes sunlight, tolerates half shad, in summer shade properly. Flowering from March to April for 3-4 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period March-April, viewing period 3-4 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, slight shade tolerance, in summer use half shade for better care
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
